comments.commentBody: Oops, I guess TY-R does cross the words after all - I was distracted by my dislike of the words involved, I guess...

She should do the right thing and resign because she is unable to perform the duties of her job. That's what good people do. They don't impose their beliefs upon others, they don't make a scene and expect folks to choose up sides, they don't fail to do their jobs because they feel like it.

Look, I am a Christian, and while I am heterosexual, I understand and empathize with those who are gay. The omniscient, omnipotent God Davis claims to worship created all people - is she insinuating that God made a mistake when He caused a huge segment of the human population to be attracted not to others of the same sex? It has been thus throughout all time. He must have known what He was doing.

"Apostolic Christian" can refer to several denominations. In another article[1], the Times identifies Ms. Davis's church as the Solid Rock Apostolic Church in Morehead, KY. Their beliefs web page does not mention government.[2]

[1] Kentucky Clerk, a Local Fixture, Suddenly Becomes a National Symbol
By ALAN BLINDER and RICHARD FAUSSET
SEPT. 1, 2015
http://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/02/us/kentucky-clerk-a-local-fixture-sudd...
[2] http://www.apostolic-churches.com/beliefs.html

You can live by gods laws in your own life. Just don't make me, and everyone else, live under them. They are your rules- not necessarily ours.

See? No one is stopping you from living the way you want to live- we are just asking you not to make us live the way you want us to live.

Simple.

I support Davis that she had the courage to deny the gay couple a licence to marry each other. She called for a higher power God's law stating “Under God’s authority,” thank you Davis for standing up for God. You may be punished by man but what you did will get the rest of us up and fight these people who have an agenda to cut down all laws that have anything to do with God.  Not to mention their promise to defill our very own children where every they may find them. Remember they are Satan's children and mean to kill God in America, a nation where we have committed ourselves to him. They have won the battle here in America but not the war. And never for a minute believe it's not a war for when it comes to my children being rape by these people I will stop at nothing.

But that is exactly the point. If she feels her values clash with her job, then she should quit her job. And stop collecting a paycheck for a job whose duties she feels she can pick and choose to carry out.
What?
Next she'll want to refuse to marry any non-Christians, insist on using protestant Christian terminology in all ceremonies, and on and on and on.

In 1960, there was always that fear that J. F. Kennedy, as a Catholic, would take orders from the pope rather than uphold the U.S. Constitution. He reassured everyone that he would not, and he did not. Funny how this has all flipped around now, where the voice of conservative religious people feel that their religion supersedes the U.S. Constitution, and then feel persecuted when they discover that it STILL does not. Odd, indeed.

So this lady has been married 4 times. She was pregnant with her third husbands twins while still married to her first husband. Then she got her second husband to adopt the kids. Then left him for the third husband who are the twins actual father. Then she moved onto her newest future ex husband. Whew!!  Someone needs to stop issuing her marriage licenses! What a f-ing hypocrite! Just cherry picking the bible to hate on gays.

So the entire American citizenry should subscribe to your conception of a deity and not think for themselves? We should all submit to your beliefs and let you thus dictate how we live our lives? Wow, how noble and modern of you.

It's a "project" -- one of those dreary apartment complexes, called Polo Grounds Towers.  I saw a couple of games there as a kid, but as a Brooklyn boy I spent more time with my uncle at Ebbets Field.  Yes, the Hated Dodgers were once my Glorious Bums.
The whole point of laws is that we don't get to decide as individuals which ones we will choose to follow. Why can't I drive 100MPH? Because it's against the law. Seems pretty simple to me.
Why should the couple have to compromise? Ms. Davis is the one breaking the law by refusing to do her job.
Well it's pretty simple. Fire her. Please do not give this woman and her bigotry any more press. Fire her. Make her go away.
She has the right o deny anyone as she feels fit. I support he choice.

Just fire her.

She has a job and refuses to do it.

I wonder what the reaction of Davis and her ilk would be if border patrol agents invoked the sanctity and primacy of their religious beliefs to refuse to deport undocumented people.

We all know the answer: those religious beliefs wouldn't stand, because zealots only permit such standing if they find the topic at hand, e.g., same-sex marriage, objectionable. Topics they support, e.g., deportation, are not permitted to be directed by religious beliefs. The law is the law, they'd say.

And that's why Davis and her tens of fans are being given so much grief. Religious belief is applied selectively, and thus is unconstitutional.

For all their flaws, the Founding Fathers got the Establishment Clause exactly right.
Won't help. It's an anti-gay group financed by Jerry Falwell/Liberty University

“….as a clerk in a county government office, she should be issuing the license. It’s her job.”   ….You don't go to work for planned parenthood if you are opposed to birth control. You don't tend bar if you are a recovering alcoholic. You don't take a job in a slaughter house if you are a vegan. WHY WHY WHY do you want to insist that YOU get to determine WHO you will issue a GOVERNMENT DOCUMENT to in the name of God.... ANY GOD. She can't serve TWO masters.... about two hours into sitting in jail she may still love one but she is about to despise the other.
She can't be fired because she was elected.  That being said she should be removed after Judge Bunning (former Senator Bunning's son) sends her to jail for contempt.
Why does this woman still have her job? She obviously isn't performing her duties. When I worked for a county agency, I didn't impose my beliefs on people that I was there to serve.
When does she go to jail? The state attorney general better file a case tomorrow!

You and Ms. Davis are certainly entitled to your beliefs; however, the US is NOT a theocracy - she cannot use her position as a public servant to impose those beliefs on others. "Freedom of religion" also means "freedom FROM religion."

My hat is off to wmar, the best science talker on the board. Don't know where he gets it, but it sure is a scientific oration of some sort, lots of polish mixed with a lotta gusto. I can't talk that stuff, so I am humbled in the face of words I don't understand, and concepts that I'd have to study for years to get.

So dang it how's come I stay so stubbornly in my opinions on the science and all of them the exact opposite of wmar's. How can I argue with wmar when I go blind looking at those graphs all over the freaking place. He knows the science ten times better than I do. What gives me the freakn' right to oppose his possibles. Why don't I just shut up and listen to him. Truth is I really don't know.

But I believe what I believe you know. I mean it's stuck in my brain like junk in a needle. All's I can do with my bank of knowledge is use what I believe to be common sense. Warm the temperature of a glass of ice water and by golly the ice melts. But he says it's cooler up there and the warmth don't mean nothing on that danged ice. I don't know, I gotta call it a whatever and move forward into battle...I guess.

Ms. Davis is not about to back down for any reason. She is now a superstar in the Christian right-wing establishment that 'has her back' covered no matter who this plays out.

Conservative Christians love to be martyrs (when not creating them) so Ms. Davis cannot lose if she loses her job. She is riding high - this is her star turn.

This is not about 'right' or 'wrong' - it is about being famous, about standing out with Ego defiant against the 'establishment'. But Ms. Davis will lose, and after a while her star will fade, but at least she will always have this shinning moment to look back upon. How pathetic.
